abstract.text: The available rendering options that you use to selectively disable
certain rendering effects.

inlineContent.text: RealityKit applies effects to the render make the AR experience more
immersive. You can selectively disable any of these effects by adding
one or more options from the

your app’s needs, but be sure to consider your app’s GPU utilization

abstract.text: Simulate and render 3D content for use in your augmented reality apps.
A view that enables you to display an AR experience with RealityKit.
A description of background, lighting, and acoustic properties for a
view’s content.
The available rendering options that you use to selectively disable
certain rendering effects.
Returns a Boolean value indicating whether two values are not equal.
The type of the elements of an array literal.
The element type of the option set.
The raw type that can be used to represent all values of the conforming
type.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether a given element is a
member of the option set.
Disable lighting from environment probes.
Disable automatic updates of the scene lighting.
Disable the image noise effect.
Disable the depth of field effect for all virtual content.
Disable generation of the face entity with the default occlusion material.
Disable automatic face occlusion.
Disable rendering of ambient occlusion and shadows that ground
objects in an AR scene.
Disable the high dynamic range post-processing effect.
Disable the motion blur for all virtual content.
Disable person segmentation.
Removes all elements of this option set that are not
also present in the given set.
Replaces this set with a new set containing all elements
contained in either this set or the given set, but not in both.
Inserts the elements of another set into this option set.
Creates an empty option set.
Creates a new set from a finite sequence of items.
Creates a set containing the elements of the given array literal.
Creates a new option set from the given raw value.
Adds the given element to the option set if it is not already a member.
Returns a new option set with only the elements contained in both this
set and the given set.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the set has no members in
common with the given set.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the set has no elements.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether this set is a strict
subset of the given set.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether this set is a strict
superset of the given set.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the set is a subset of
another set.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the set is a superset of
the given set.
The corresponding value of the raw type.
Removes the given element and all elements subsumed by it.
Removes the elements of the given set from this set.
Returns a new set containing the elements of this set that do not occur
in the given set.
Returns a new option set with the elements contained in this set or in
the given set, but not in both.
Returns a new option set of the elements contained in this set, in the
given set, or in both.
Inserts the given element into the set.
The render options that configure the view’s AR session.
The rendering technique used to smooth edges of virtual content.
Options that determine the state of high dynamic range rendering for virtual content.
A struct that determines the background and default lighting properties for a reality view.
A mode that determines whether a rendering effect is enabled or disabled.
A struct for enabling and disabling rendering effects for RealityKit content.
Measure CPU and GPU utilization to find ways to improve your app’s performance.

doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation.title: Improving the Performance of a RealityKit App

abstract.text: Prevent the GPU from limiting your app’s frame rate by reducing the complexity of
your render.

doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation.title: Reducing GPU Utilization in Your RealityKit App

abstract.text: A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type that can be converted to and from an associated raw value.
A type that provides mathematical set operations.
A type that can be initialized using an array literal.
A type that presents a mathematical set interface to a bit set.
